meanings.definition: A group of employees working for an organization.
meanings.sent1: The hotel staffs are always friendly and helpful.
meanings.sent2: The school staffs work together to ensure a safe environment for students.
meanings.sent3: The staffs at the zoo had a meeting to discuss how to make the animals laugh.
meanings.sent4: The staffs of the spaceship were like a well-oiled machine, working together seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The staffs in the restaurant wore matching uniforms, making them easy to spot.

meanings.definition: A long stick used for support or walking.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa used a staff to help him walk in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The hiker leaned on his staff as he climbed up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The wizard's staffs were enchanted, helping him cast powerful spells.
meanings.sent4: The staff was like a loyal companion, supporting the traveler on his journey.
meanings.sent5: The staff had intricate carvings, telling the story of its previous owners.

meanings.definition: The plural form of staff, referring to a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The staffs at the event were all dressed in matching uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The staffs of the company gathered for a team-building exercise.
meanings.sent3: The staffs decided to have a potluck to celebrate their hard work.
meanings.sent4: The staffs were like a family, always supporting each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The staffs lined up for a group photo to commemorate their successful project completion.
